title: Crypto Regulations in the USA 2025
body: The post Crypto Regulations in the USA 2025 appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News The US crypto regulation has changed dramatically in 2025, with the Trump administration adopting a pro-innovation, pro-crypto approach. Major developments included new executive orders, the disbanding of enforcement teams, and a shift toward clear, comprehensive legislation. The year saw a move away from ‚Äúregulation by enforcement‚Äù toward structured rules and federal clarity, while states continued to play a key role in shaping the regulatory environment. Table of contents US Crypto Regulations 2025 What Do The US Federal Agencies Think About Crypto in 2025? US Crypto Tax 2025 Short-Term Crypto Tax Rates (Held ‚â§ 1 Year) Long-Term Crypto Tax Rates (Held > 1 Year) Additional Crypto Tax Rules Example Crypto Adoption Rate In America Crypto mining in the USA US Government‚Äôs Crypto Holdings Conclusion FAQs US Crypto Regulations 2025 June 17, 2025: The US Senate passed the GENIUS ACT with 68-30 votes, the first federal regulatory framework for stablecoins. May 8, 2025 ‚Äì Wyoming and Texas push forward new pro-crypto laws; other states test blockchain in public services and launch regulatory sandboxes. Early May 2025 ‚Äì U.S. repeals Executive Order 14067 and outdated Treasury crypto policies; SEC unveils new framework for digital asset securities; GENIUS stablecoin bill nears finalization; OCC releases Interpretive Letter 1183 allowing banks to custody digital assets. April 12, 2025 ‚Äì Senate Banking Committee announces plans to pass a comprehensive crypto market bill by August; Securities Clarity Act reintroduced in the House . April 2025 ‚Äì Congress accelerates deregulatory efforts and develops laws to clarify digital asset regulation under the Trump administration. March 12, 2025 ‚Äì White House publicly supports stablecoins and cryptocurrencies, signaling regulatory easing and push for adoption. March 6, 2025 ‚Äì President Trump signs Executive Order to create the Strategic Bitcoin Reserve and U.S. Digital Asset Stockpile . April 2025 ‚Äì DOJ‚Äôs National Cryptocurrency Enforcement Team is disbanded ; SEC drops major lawsuits against Gemini and Coinbase. Early February 2025 ‚Äì Federal Stablecoins Bill advances, with bipartisan support and a clear 2025 regulatory roadmap. January 23, 2025 ‚Äì President Trump issues Executive Order ‚Äú Strengthening American Leadership in Digital Financial Technology ,‚Äù promoting fair banking access and crypto innovation. What Do The US Federal Agencies Think About Crypto in 2025? SEC: The SEC, under new leadership, is moving away from aggressive enforcement and toward developing clear regulatory lines, realistic registration paths, and sensible disclosure guidelines for crypto assets. CFTC: The CFTC is collaborating with the SEC and Congress to clarify jurisdiction, especially over digital commodities and derivatives. FinCEN: AML and CFT requirements remain central, with crypto companies classified as financial institutions under the Bank Secrecy Act, subject to strict compliance. FDIC/OCC: The FDIC has eased restrictions on banks‚Äô crypto activities, while the OCC supports banks‚Äô ability to custody digital assets US Crypto Tax 2025 Cryptocurrency in the US is taxed based on how long you hold the asset and your total taxable income. Short-term gains (assets held for one year or less) are taxed at ordinary income rates, while long-term gains (assets held for more than a year) are taxed at lower capital gains rates. Additionally, income from mining, staking, or receiving crypto as payment is taxed as ordinary income. Short-Term Crypto Tax Rates (Held ‚â§ 1 Year) Tax Rate Single Married Filing Jointly Married Filing Separately Head of Household 10% $0‚Äì$11,600 $0‚Äì$23,200 $0‚Äì$11,600 $0‚Äì$16,550 12% $11,601‚Äì$47,150 $23,201‚Äì$94,300 $11,601‚Äì$47,150 $16,551‚Äì$63,100 22% $47,151‚Äì$100,525 $94,301‚Äì$201,050 $47,151‚Äì$100,525 $63,101‚Äì$100,500 24% $100,526‚Äì$191,950 $201,051‚Äì$383,900 $100,526‚Äì$191,950 $100,501‚Äì$191,950 32% $191,951‚Äì$243,725 $383,901‚Äì$487,450 $191,951‚Äì$243,725 $191,951‚Äì$243,700 37% Over $609,351 Over $731,201 Over $365,601 Over $609,351 Long-Term Crypto Tax Rates (Held > 1 Year) Tax Rate Single Married Filing Jointly Married Filing Separately Head of Household 0% Up to $47,025 Up to $94,050 Up to $47,025 Up to $63,000 15% $47,026‚Äì$518,900 $94,051‚Äì$583,750 $47,026‚Äì$291,850 $63,001‚Äì$551,350 20% Over $518,900 Over $583,750 Over $291,850 Over $551,350 Additional Crypto Tax Rules Income from mining, staking, or payment: Taxed as ordinary income at the above rates. NFTs: Some may be taxed at a higher collectibles rate (up to 28%). Non-taxable events: Transfers between your own wallets and certain gifts are not taxable. Crypto companies: Subject to standard corporate income tax and must comply with reporting and AML/CFT rules. Example If you are single, earn $50,000 in total taxable income, and realize $5,000 short-term crypto gains and $10,000 long-term crypto gains: Short-term gains taxed at 22%: $1,100 Long-term gains taxed at 15%: $1,500 Total crypto tax owed: $2,600 These rates and rules ensure all crypto investors and companies are taxed in line with other property and investment assets in the US Crypto Adoption Rate In America In 2025, about 28% of American adults‚Äîaround 65 million people‚Äîown cryptocurrency. Crypto ownership in the US has nearly doubled since 2021, rising from 15% to 28%. 14% of non-owners plan to buy crypto in 2025, and 67% of current owners plan to buy more this year. Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dogecoin are the top three cryptocurrencies Americans plan to purchase in 2025. Crypto mining in the USA In 2025, the US leads the world in Bitcoin mining , accounting for over one-third of global mining power. On March 20, 2025, the SEC clarified that proof-of-work crypto mining is not subject to federal securities laws, removing registration requirements for miners. There is no federal ban on crypto mining; regulation is handled at the state level, with some states offering incentives and others imposing environmental restrictions. The Trump administration‚Äôs deregulatory approach in 2025 has encouraged domestic mining growth, but all miners must still comply with federal AML and CFT rules. Environmental concerns and energy usage debates continue, especially in states considering stricter oversight or moratoriums on mining operations. US Government‚Äôs Crypto Holdings As of April 2025, the US government holds approximately 198,012 Bitcoins, valued at about $18.3 billion. The US is the world‚Äôs largest state holder of Bitcoin, with these assets primarily acquired through law enforcement seizures and forfeitures. In March 2025, President Trump established the Strategic Bitcoin Reserve and a broader Digital Asset Stockpile, consolidating all federally held Bitcoin and other major cryptocurrencies (including Ethereum, Solana, Cardano, and XRP) as permanent reserve assets. Conclusion US crypto regulation in 2025 marks a major turning point. The old approach of punishing innovation is being replaced with clear rules, legal support, and a national strategy for digital assets. While financial crimes are still a concern, the overall direction is bold, business-friendly, and built for long-term crypto adoption. [article_inside_subscriber_shortcode title=‚ÄùNever Miss a Beat in the Crypto World!‚Äù description=‚ÄùStay ahead with breaking news, expert analysis, and real-time updates on the latest trends in Bitcoin, altcoins, DeFi, NFTs, and more.‚Äù category_name=‚ÄùCrypto Regulation‚Äù category_id=‚Äù6‚Ä≥] FAQs Is crypto regulated by the SEC? The SEC regulates crypto assets that are considered securities. In 2025, the SEC is moving towards clearer regulatory guidelines. What are the IRS rules for crypto? The IRS treats crypto as property, taxing gains as capital gains and income from mining/staking as ordinary income. What is the Strategic Bitcoin Reserve? Established by Trump in March 2025, it‚Äôs a federal reserve for Bitcoin, initially capitalized by seized BTC, aiming to manage holdings strategically. How has US crypto regulation changed in 2025? In 2025, the US shifted to a pro-innovation, pro-crypto approach under Trump, with new executive orders and a move toward clear federal legislation. How much tax on crypto USA? In the US, short-term crypto gains (held ‚â§ 1 year) are taxed at ordinary income rates (10-37%), while long-term gains (> 1 year) are taxed at lower capital gains rates (0-20%), based on your income and filing status. Sources

title: Bitcoin Slips to $106K Amid Market Caution, Powell Offers No Timeline on Rate Cut
body: Bitcoin has witnessed a dip below the support area on Wednesday, resulting in the expected quick decline. The descending triangle comes amid Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell having a long-term hold on his ‚Äúwait and see‚Äù approach to Fed interest rate cuts. Similar to the stock market, Bitcoin‚Äôs price have become increasingly tied to interest rates and other macroeconomic indicators recently. As a result, escalating tensions between Powell and President Trump have caused BTC and other tokens to slump. The world‚Äôs largest crypto dropped below $106,000 on Wednesday, extending its decline by 2.47% over the last two days. Last week, Bitcoin rose sharply by 7.32%, closing above $108,000. However, since Monday, Bitcoin has continued its decline after facing a correction, closing below $106,000. At the time of writing, the token hovered around $106,998. ‚ÄúRate cut expectations, political tensions, and a declining apparent demand signal some short-term caution,‚Äù James Toledano, COO at Unity Wallet, told Cryptonews. However, he is optimistic that despite the scenario, markets would experience momentum into Q3. Crypto Markets Dip Following Powell Comments Fed Chair Powell on Tuesday commented on the President‚Äôs aggressive lobbying to cut interest rates. Trump has been putting pressure to follow central banks worldwide that have acted faster. During the European Central Bank‚Äôs annual conference in Portugal, Powell said that the decision depends on ‚Äúhow the data evolves.‚Äù However, he did not hint at the timing of rate cuts. Trump and Powell have been playing a blame game recently over the Fed rate cuts. The President had sent a handwritten note to Powell on Monday, accusing the Fed Chair ‚Äúfor allowing this to happen to the United States.‚Äù ‚ÄúIf they were doing their job properly, our Country would be saving Trillions of Dollars in Interest Cost,‚Äù Trump‚Äôs note read. Besides, the President has encouraged Powell to resign before his term as chair ends in May. ‚ÄúNo inflation, our country‚Äôs strong, our interest rates should be 3 points lower‚Ä¶you‚Äôve got a moron at the head of the Fed. He‚Äôs a moron!‚Äù ‚Äì @POTUS blasts Jerome Powell as he speaks to the press on Air Force One! pic.twitter.com/wPURpZBdNj ‚Äî Real America's Voice (RAV) (@RealAmVoice) July 1, 2025 When asked about President Trump‚Äôs pressure on Tuesday, Powell said that he is very focused on just doing his job. Further, interest rates would have lowered by now if not for the president‚Äôs tariff agenda, Powell added. Following Powell‚Äôs comment, Bitcoin saw a 1.3% slump, trading at $105,859 on Tuesday. ‚ÄúPresident Trump is yet again voicing his intent to remove Fed Chair Jerome Powell, and this, more than any other macroeconomic factor, has the ability to cause more short-term financial havoc,‚Äù Toledano told Cryptonews. However, he added that these provoke short‚Äëterm moves, while long‚Äëterm direction is driven by fundamentals. ‚ÄúBitcoin is only going one way as far as the arc of history is concerned.‚Äù The post Bitcoin Slips to $106K Amid Market Caution, Powell Offers No Timeline on Rate Cut appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: xAI‚Äôs Astounding $10 Billion Funding Fuels Next-Gen AI Development
body: BitcoinWorld xAI‚Äôs Astounding $10 Billion Funding Fuels Next-Gen AI Development In a move that sent ripples across the technology and investment landscape, Elon Musk‚Äôs artificial intelligence company, xAI, has successfully raised an astounding $10 billion in a combined debt and equity financing round. This colossal capital injection underscores the intense global race for AI dominance and highlights the immense confidence investors place in xAI‚Äôs ambitious vision. For those closely watching the intersection of cutting-edge technology and digital assets, xAI‚Äôs latest funding signifies a powerful surge in AI capabilities that could profoundly influence the broader tech ecosystem, including blockchain and cryptocurrency innovations. The Unprecedented xAI Funding: A Dual Capital Approach The confirmation came directly from financial titan Morgan Stanley on Monday, July 1, 2025, detailing the significant capital raise. xAI secured $5 billion through debt financing and an additional $5 billion via a separate, strategic equity transaction. This dual-pronged approach to fundraising is a shrewd financial maneuver, as Morgan Stanley highlighted in a post on X: Reduced Cost of Capital: Combining debt and equity effectively lowers the overall cost of capital for xAI, making the funding more efficient. Expanded Capital Pools: This strategy substantially broadens the range of capital available to the company, drawing from diverse investor types. Strategic Allocation: The proceeds are earmarked to support xAI‚Äôs continued development of cutting-edge AI solutions, with a particular focus on establishing one of the world‚Äôs largest data centers and advancing its flagship Grok platform. This massive infusion of capital positions xAI to accelerate its ambitious projects, ensuring it has the resources to compete with established AI giants and disruptive startups alike. Fueling Advanced AI Development and the Grok Platform The core purpose of this substantial funding is to propel xAI‚Äôs advanced AI development . The company‚Äôs ambitions are grand, including the construction of one of the world‚Äôs largest data centers ‚Äì a critical piece of infrastructure for training and deploying sophisticated AI models. This commitment to physical infrastructure signals xAI‚Äôs long-term play in the AI space, aiming for scale and computational power that few can match. Central to xAI‚Äôs offerings is the Grok platform , an AI chatbot designed to be witty, rebellious, and informed by real-time data from X. With this new funding, Grok is poised for significant enhancements, potentially expanding its capabilities, improving its response accuracy, and broadening its user base. The competition in the conversational AI market is fierce, with players like OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT and Anthropic‚Äôs Claude constantly pushing boundaries. xAI‚Äôs ability to secure such significant funding demonstrates a strong belief in Grok‚Äôs potential to carve out a dominant niche. Elon Musk‚Äôs AI Vision and Impressive Investor Backing This latest funding round follows a substantial $6 billion raise in December, bringing xAI‚Äôs total capital raised to approximately $17 billion . Such rapid and large-scale fundraising speaks volumes about the market‚Äôs confidence in Elon Musk‚Äôs vision for AI. Musk, known for his audacious goals with Tesla and SpaceX, is applying the same disruptive philosophy to artificial intelligence, aiming to create AI that can truly understand the universe. The list of investors participating in xAI‚Äôs funding rounds reads like a who‚Äôs who of global finance and venture capital. Key investors from the December round included: Andreessen Horowitz Blackrock Fidelity Lightspeed MGX Morgan Stanley OIA QIA Sequoia Capital Valor Equity Partners Vy Capital Nvidia AMD Kingdom Holdings (a Saudi conglomerate) The continued involvement of major financial institutions and technology giants like Nvidia and AMD, who are critical suppliers for AI hardware, further validates xAI‚Äôs strategic importance and future potential in the rapidly evolving AI landscape. The Broader Impact of AI Investment The sheer scale of AI investment , exemplified by xAI‚Äôs latest raise, highlights a critical trend: AI is no longer a niche technology but a foundational layer for future innovation across all industries. For the cryptocurrency and blockchain sectors, this means several things: Enhanced Infrastructure: More powerful AI models require more robust computational infrastructure, which can drive innovation in decentralized computing solutions and potentially create new use cases for blockchain-based resource sharing. AI-Powered Analytics: Advanced AI can bring sophisticated analytics to crypto markets, improving trading strategies, risk assessment, and fraud detection. Decentralized AI: The massive funding in centralized AI entities might also spur increased interest and investment in decentralized AI projects, seeking to democratize AI access and prevent monopolization. New AI-Crypto Integrations: As AI models become more capable, their integration with smart contracts, decentralized applications (dApps), and Web3 initiatives will become more seamless, leading to novel applications and services. The race for AI supremacy is intensifying, and capital is flowing into the sector at an unprecedented rate. This creates both opportunities and challenges, pushing the boundaries of what AI can achieve and influencing technological advancements across the board. Conclusion: A New Chapter for AI Innovation xAI‚Äôs remarkable $10 billion funding round marks a pivotal moment in the company‚Äôs trajectory and the broader AI industry. With substantial capital, a clear vision from Elon Musk, and a growing suite of products like the Grok platform, xAI is well-positioned to make significant strides in artificial intelligence development. This investment not only empowers xAI to build critical infrastructure and refine its models but also underscores the global conviction that AI will be the defining technology of the coming decades. As AI capabilities continue to expand, its symbiotic relationship with emerging technologies like blockchain and cryptocurrencies will undoubtedly lead to exciting and transformative innovations. To learn more about the latest AI market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI models‚Äô future features and institutional adoption. title: Genesis AI Unlocks Revolutionary Robotics AI with $105M Seed Funding
body: BitcoinWorld Genesis AI Unlocks Revolutionary Robotics AI with $105M Seed Funding The world of artificial intelligence is witnessing an unprecedented surge, with innovation driving monumental shifts across industries. For those accustomed to the rapid evolution and high-stakes investments in the cryptocurrency space, the latest news from the robotics sector offers a compelling parallel. A new player, Genesis AI , has emerged from stealth mode, making waves with a staggering $105 million seed funding round. This significant capital injection, co-led by venture capital giants Eclipse Ventures and Khosla Ventures, signals a profound belief in Genesis AI‚Äôs ambitious mission: to construct the foundational AI models that will power the next generation of robots. What Makes Genesis AI a Game-Changer in Robotics? At its core, Genesis AI is not just another robotics company; it‚Äôs an endeavor to solve one of the most persistent challenges in AI development for physical systems. Founded in December last year by Dr. Zhou Xian, a robotics Ph.D. from Carnegie Mellon University, and Th√©ophile Gervet, a former research scientist at the renowned French AI lab Mistral, the startup is charting a course to build a general-purpose model. Imagine a single AI brain capable of enabling robots to automate a vast array of repetitive tasks, from intricate lab experiments to routine household chores. This vision moves beyond single-task robots towards truly versatile and adaptable robotic systems. The ambition of Genesis AI lies in its pursuit of a universal ‚Äúlanguage‚Äù for robots, a foundational model that understands and interacts with the physical world in a highly generalized manner. This contrasts sharply with traditional robotic programming, which often requires bespoke code for each specific task or environment. By developing a comprehensive understanding of physics and interaction, Genesis AI aims to unlock unprecedented levels of autonomy and flexibility in robotic applications, potentially transforming manufacturing, logistics, healthcare, and even daily life. The Quest for Universal AI Models : Bridging the Physical and Digital Divide The development of sophisticated AI models for robotics presents unique hurdles compared to, say, large language models (LLMs). While LLMs thrive on vast datasets of text and code, AI for robots demands data rooted in the complexities of the physical world. This includes everything from how objects behave under different forces to the nuances of human-robot interaction and environmental variables. Acquiring such real-world data is notoriously expensive, time-consuming, and often impractical due to safety concerns or the sheer scale required for robust training. This is where Genesis AI‚Äôs innovative approach shines. Recognizing the prohibitive nature of real-world data collection, the company is turning to synthetic data . This isn‚Äôt just any simulated data; it‚Äôs generated using a proprietary physics engine. This engine, the result of an academic project led by Zhou Xian in collaboration with researchers from 18 universities, is touted for its ability to accurately model the physical world. This sophisticated simulation capability allows Genesis AI to create an endless supply of diverse and high-quality training data, sidestepping many of the limitations faced by competitors relying solely on real-world datasets. The team behind this breakthrough comprises over 20 researchers specializing in robotics, machine learning, and graphics ‚Äì many of whom were integral to the original academic project. Their combined expertise is critical in refining this synthetic data engine, ensuring that the simulated environments and interactions are realistic enough to train highly effective AI models that can then translate seamlessly to real-world robotic applications. Why Synthetic Data is the Key to Scalable Robotics AI The strategic reliance on synthetic data provides Genesis AI with a distinct competitive advantage. Here‚Äôs why it‚Äôs a game-changer for scalable robotics AI : Speed of Development: By generating data internally, Genesis AI can iterate and train its models much faster than companies dependent on collecting data from physical robots, which is a slow and resource-intensive process. Cost Efficiency: Eliminating the need for extensive physical testing and data collection significantly reduces operational costs, allowing for more resources to be allocated to research and development. Data Diversity and Control: Synthetic environments allow for the generation of edge cases, rare scenarios, and a wider variety of conditions that might be difficult or dangerous to reproduce in the real world. This leads to more robust and generalized AI models. Safety: Training in a simulated environment means no risk to physical hardware or human operators during the early stages of development and testing. This approach directly challenges the traditional paradigm, where companies often rely on external software or hardware, such as NVIDIA‚Äôs tools, for simulation. Genesis AI‚Äôs proprietary engine offers them greater control and customization, potentially enabling them to develop and refine their models at an unmatched pace. This agility is crucial in the fast-evolving landscape of AI and robotics, where speed to market and continuous improvement are paramount. Pioneering Foundational Models : Genesis AI‚Äôs Unique Edge The concept of foundational models , popularized by large language models, is now being extended to the physical realm by companies like Genesis AI. The goal is to create a single, massive model that can serve as a base for a multitude of robotic tasks, rather than developing individual AI solutions for each specific function. This represents a paradigm shift, moving from narrow AI to a more general, adaptable intelligence for machines. The investment from Khosla Ventures, a firm known for its bold bets on transformative technologies, underscores the potential impact of Genesis AI‚Äôs work. Kanu Gulati, a partner at Khosla Ventures, articulated this vision clearly: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a big unknown: Will anybody have a large robotics foundation model that will generalize across tasks? That‚Äôs a bet we want to go after.‚Äù She added, ‚ÄúOf all the teams we have seen, we like [Genesis‚Äôs] approach for going after robotics foundation models.‚Äù This endorsement highlights the uniqueness and perceived effectiveness of Genesis AI‚Äôs strategy. While Genesis AI is forging ahead, it operates within a competitive landscape. Other notable players also striving to develop general-purpose AI models for robots include Physical Intelligence, which recently secured a hefty $400 million funding round, and Skild AI, valued at an impressive $4 billion earlier this year. These valuations underscore the immense market potential and the intense race to achieve a breakthrough in universal robotics AI. Genesis AI‚Äôs $105 million seed round, while smaller than some of these later-stage investments, is exceptionally large for a seed round, indicating strong investor confidence in its early progress and unique methodology. What Does This Funding Mean for the Future of Automation? The $105 million seed funding will undoubtedly accelerate Genesis AI‚Äôs development efforts. With offices strategically located in Silicon Valley and Paris, the company is leveraging global talent pools to refine its synthetic data engine and build out its foundational model. The dual-location strategy allows for diverse perspectives and access to leading researchers in both robotics and AI. A key milestone on their roadmap is the planned release of their model to the broader robotics community by the end of the year. This move is significant, as it could foster collaboration, encourage adoption, and potentially establish Genesis AI‚Äôs model as a standard in the burgeoning field of general-purpose robotics AI. Such a release would not only validate their approach but also catalyze further innovation across the industry, enabling countless new applications for automation. The implications of a truly general-purpose robotics AI are vast. From automating hazardous industrial tasks to providing personalized assistance in homes, the potential for efficiency gains, cost reductions, and improved quality of life is immense. This funding isn‚Äôt just about building better robots; it‚Äôs about laying the groundwork for a future where intelligent machines can seamlessly integrate into and enhance various facets of human society. For investors and enthusiasts alike, Genesis AI represents a powerful indicator of where the cutting edge of AI development is heading, promising a future where robots are not just tools, but intelligent, adaptable partners. To learn more about the latest AI market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI Models features. This post Genesis AI Unlocks Revolutionary Robotics AI with $105M Seed Funding first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Altcoin Season Starting Soon? Analyst Predicts 37% Crash In Bitcoin Dominance
body: The Bitcoin dominance remaining on the high side has been one of the major hindrances for the altcoin season. Going by past performances, the Bitcoin dominance would have to crash for altcoins to have a chance to rally, but with the dominance still climbing, the chances of an altcoin season remain slim. As this trend continues, a crypto analyst has predicted a possible turn in the tide for the Bitcoin dominance, predicting a crash that could give altcoins a chance. Bitcoin Dominance Rejection From Trendline Is Key Over the years, the Bitcoin dominance has been following a trendline that has often marked the point of resistance. This trendline rises from 2017 and has sloped down past 2021 and now into the year 2025. The significance behind this is the breakdown from the trendline and the Bitcoin dominance receding sharply from here. Related Reading: Pundit Warns Bitcoin Is Setting Up Liquidity Traps As It Campaigns For New ATHs Presently, the Bitcoin dominance is still sitting high above 65% at the time of this writing, but this recent rise has seen it touch the resistance trendline. According to crypto analyst CoreCrypto, this is a critical inflection point, especially on the weekly chart. More importantly, this is usually the point where dominance recedes, giving rise to altcoin dominance. Some major developments that the analyst tells investors to watch on the dominance chart include a rejection from the resistance trendline, where the dominance currently lies above 65%. There is also support for the dominance, as shown by the yellow line in the chart below. A break below this support is critical for the fall in the dominance. Another development to watch out for is for rising Ethereum strength. In the past, the Ethereum price starting to outperform the Bitcoin price has often signaled the start of the altcoin season. So, as the ETHBTC chart begins to strengthen and Bitcoin succumbs to sideways movement, it opens the door for altcoins to rally into the next altcoin season. Related Reading: Bitcoin Price At $145,000 In September? Bullish Dojis Suggest Upward Move In the event of a break from the resistance trendline, the analyst sees the possibility of a sharp decline. CoreCrypto predicts a 36.91% drop to the 42%-45% levels. This is lower compared to previous altcoin seasons, but follows the declining trend of a 50.79% drop in 2017 compared to a 45.10% drop in 2021. ‚ÄúIf BTC.D gets rejected from this resistance again, it could mark the start of the long-awaited Altseason 2025,‚Äù the crypto analyst explained. ‚ÄúA breakdown from this wedge would likely result in capital rotation from BTC into altcoins ‚Äî just like in previous cycles.‚Äù Featured image from Dall.E, chart from TradingView.com

title: US Bitcoin ETFs end 15-day inflow streak as BTC price faces bearish momentum
body: Spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds in the U.S. saw net outflows for the first time in nearly three weeks as investors positioned cautiously ahead of what has historically been a slower quarter for Bitcoin. According to data from SoSoValue, the 12 U.S.-listed spot Bitcoin ETFs recorded a combined $342.25 million in net outflows on July 1. This marked the end of a robust 15-day inflow streak that had brought in a cumulative $4.73 billion into the funds since mid-June. Fidelity‚Äôs FBTC led the withdrawals with $172.73 million in outflows, followed by Grayscale‚Äôs GBTC, which saw $119.51 million redeemed. ARK 21Shares‚Äô ARKB and Bitwise‚Äôs BITB also contributed to the net redemptions, recording outflows of $27.03 million and $22.98 million, respectively. Notably, BlackRock‚Äôs IBIT, the top-performing ETF during the recent inflow streak, saw zero net movement on the day, while the remaining ETFs also recorded no activity. In contrast, spot Ethereum ETFs recorded a third consecutive day of net inflows. On Tuesday, ETH-focused funds collectively attracted $40.68 million. The majority of these inflows came from BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA, which posted $54.84 million in net additions, and Grayscale‚Äôs ETHE, which added $9.96 million. These gains were partially offset by $24.11 million in outflows from Fidelity‚Äôs FETH. You might also like: Dow Jones up 300 points as Senate passes Trump‚Äôs budget, Tesla drops 8% The sharp reversal in Bitcoin ETF flows coincided with the U.S. Senate‚Äôs passage of the so-called ‚ÄúBig Beautiful Bill‚Äù on July 1, a sweeping $3.3 trillion spending package passed with a narrow 51‚Äì50 vote, with Vice President J.D. Vance breaking the tie. Despite lobbying from pro-crypto lawmakers, the 1,000-page legislation did not include any specific provisions related to Bitcoin, crypto mining, or staking, disappointing portions of the digital asset industry. The bill will now return to the House for final reconciliation ahead of the July 4 deadline set by the president for signature. The absence of crypto-related language in the legislation, despite initial optimism, may have contributed to the profit-taking seen across Bitcoin-related funds. The broader cryptocurrency market reacted by dropping nearly 2.3% to an intraday low of $3.36 trillion as of press time. Bitcoin ( BTC ) dropped close to 2% to a session low near $105,000 on Wednesday morning. According to CoinGlass data , total crypto market liquidations reached $242.6 million on July 1, with the majority stemming from long position liquidations. This indicates that bullish traders either closed or were forced out of their positions, likely securing profits or limiting downside exposure, while bearish positioning remained intact. Historically, the third quarter has underperformed relative to other periods, as noted by analysts. Since 2013, Bitcoin has averaged just a 5.47% gain in Q3, making it the weakest of the four quarters in terms of historical returns, according to CoinGlass data. This trend may be contributing to the cautious repositioning among investors. When writing, Bitcoin had shed some of its intraday losses and was back above $107k, up nearly 40% from its year-to-date low of $76,300 seen in early April. Read more: Bitcoin faces rejection ‚Äî Bearish Divergence signals breakdown potential Disclosure: This article does not represent investment advice. The content and materials featured on this page are for educational purposes only.

title: Trump raises tax credits for US chipmakers from 25% to 35%
body: Tax breaks for chipmakers building in the US just got a major upgrade after the Senate passed Donald Trump‚Äôs latest bill on Tuesday. The legislation bumps tax credits for semiconductor manufacturing from 25% to 35%, giving companies like Intel, Micron, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company a bigger reason to set up new plants across American soil. The goal, according to CNBC , is to pull more of the world‚Äôs advanced chip production away from Asia and get it done at home before a 2026 deadline kicks in. This is Trump‚Äôs attempt to pile more weight behind domestic chipmaking after earlier efforts like the 2022 CHIPS and Science Act, which had offered $39 billion in grants and $75 billion in loans. His latest bill offers a more aggressive incentive: bigger long-term tax breaks instead of temporary handouts. A draft version of the bill had included a 30% credit, but the final version passed Tuesday pushes it to 35%, giving semiconductor companies even more breathing room for costly US projects. House Republicans threaten to block Senate bill Despite getting through the Senate, the fight isn‚Äôt over. Trump‚Äôs bill now faces a new round in the House of Representatives, which passed its own version of the bill last month. Trump wants final approval by July 4, but that deadline might not hold up. Speaker Mike Johnson is facing resistance from his own party, and with the vote margins razor-thin, he can‚Äôt afford to lose more than three Republicans if every member shows up. Andy Ogles, a Republican from Tennessee, said Tuesday on X, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt work for the Senate parliamentarian. I work for the PEOPLE.‚Äù He called the Senate bill a ‚Äúdud‚Äù and has already submitted an amendment to swap it with the House‚Äôs version. Ralph Norman, another Republican from South Carolina, is also opposing the Senate‚Äôs text. Thomas Massie of Kentucky and Warren Davidson of Ohio, who both voted against the earlier House version in May, are expected to vote no again. Andy Harris, a Republican from Maryland who chairs the House Freedom Caucus, didn‚Äôt vote for or against the bill last time. He just voted ‚Äúpresent,‚Äù which gives no clear signal where he stands now. But if Johnson loses more than three Republican votes, the bill doesn‚Äôt pass, and the 35% credit never becomes law. Trump rejects Biden‚Äôs chip policy and pushes tariffs instead While Trump is trying to boost US fabs with tax incentives, he‚Äôs also gunning for Biden‚Äôs CHIPS Act, which focused more on giving out grants. Earlier this year, Trump called for that entire law to be repealed. Republican lawmakers haven‚Äôt moved on that demand, but Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick confirmed last month that the administration is in the middle of renegotiating some of the grant terms from Biden‚Äôs version. Trump‚Äôs approach skips the handouts and leans hard on tariffs. His administration has launched an investigation into semiconductor imports, which could lead to new duties on foreign chip technology. That adds more pressure on companies that don‚Äôt want to deal with unpredictable trade costs. Instead, they‚Äôre now speeding up construction in the US to avoid that whole mess. Major names like TSMC , Nvidia, Micron, and GlobalFoundries have already ramped up US projects in recent months. They want to make sure they‚Äôre in position to claim the credits before the 2026 deadline passes. Companies that miss that window don‚Äôt get the deal. The Senate passed the bill with Vice President JD Vance breaking a 50-50 tie. But Johnson‚Äôs real challenge now is keeping his party together in the House. No Democrats are expected to support the bill, and with Republican objections growing, the odds are getting tighter by the hour. Trump is demanding the House push the bill through before Independence Day, but the numbers don‚Äôt lie‚Äîif even four Republicans vote no, the bill dies. title: Crypto Regulations In Indonesia 2025
body: The post Crypto Regulations In Indonesia 2025 appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News In 2025, Indonesia made a big shift in its crypto regulatory framework oversight as it transitioned from Bappebti to OJK. The Indonesian crypto market is experiencing significant growth in transaction volume and user numbers, driven by a tech-savvy population and increasing interest in digital assets. Indonesia has legalized the trading of crypto but has reasonably regulated it with strict regulations. Table of contents Crypto regulations in Indonesia 2025 What is the Indonesian Government Saying About Crypto? Crypto License in Indonesia 2025 Crypto Tax in Indonesia 2025 Crypto Adoption in Indonesia Conclusion FAQs Crypto regulations in Indonesia 2025 March 2025- OJK issued licenses for Digital Financial Assets (DFA) Traders OJK issued 19 DFA traders‚Äô licenses , and they were processing 11 other licenses at the time. This initiative was part of a broader framework that includes a license for DFA exchanges, clearing, guarantee, settlement institutions, and custodians for digital assets under OJK supervision. January 10, 2025- Government Regulation No. 49 of 2024 and OJK Regulation No. 27 of 2024 The supervision of crypto assets officially transitioned from the Commodity Futures Trading Regulatory Agency (Bappebti) to the Financial Services Authority (OJK). The new OJK regulation outlines minimum paid-up capital and equity requirements and includes detailed guidelines for onboarding customers. It also implemented a new tax regime for crypto as it became subject to both income tax and value-added tax. The OJK also implemented Digital Financial Asset Trading, Including Crypto Assets, which outlines licensing, transition of applications, updates the crypto asset whitelist, and the adjustment period. January 1-6, 2025- Crypto Tax (PMK No. 131/2024 and PMK No. 81/2024) The value-added tax (VAT) was increased to 0.11% of transaction value, and for unregistered exchange platforms, the VAT rate doubles to 0.22% . While crypto tax is very low in the country, it is not totally free as it subjects mining to tax up to 0.1%. What is the Indonesian Government Saying About Crypto? In 2025, the Indonesian government is actively working on enhancing consumer protection facilities to foster a more secure and stable environment for crypto trading. The implementation of OJK supervision aims to help the public better understand the opportunities and risks involved in crypto investments. The initiative also indicates a move towards treating them as financial instruments alongside traditional assets. This integration aims to bring greater clarity and stability to the crypto market. With stricter regulation under OJK, indonesia is aiming to boost transparency and fraud prevention, which could help mitigate risks in the crypto space. The OJK also introduced a regulatory sandbox, a testing environment for new financial technologies, including crypto. With this measure, the Indonesian government is aiming to embrace innovation. Crypto License in Indonesia 2025 OJK reclassified crypto assets as digital financial assets under new terms to regulate licensing. It also changed Bappebti‚Äôs authority to issue the list of crypto assets that could be traded on crypto platforms and gave the authority to the DFA. DFA issued its first list in April 2025, which contained 1,444 crypto assets, marking an increase from Bappebti‚Äôs listing of 851. Licensing: Companies previously licensed under Bappebti will automatically be recognized as licensed Digital Financial Asset Trading Providers. However, a reapplication is necessary after which the DFA traders can provide the whitelist of crypto assets. A grace period till July 2025 is given to fully comply with new requirements. Requirement for DFA Traders: The minimum paid-up capital of 100 billion rupiah (US$6 million) and minimum equity of 50 billion rupiah (US$3 million) requirement is retained from Bappebti‚Äôs authority, while four new key changes are introduced under OJK: Fit and Proper Test for board members, shareholders, and controlling shareholders is introduced. DFA traders are to store transaction data and financial records for at least ten consecutive years. Requirements for data protection measures are to be followed. Stricter restrictions for DFA members‚Äì cannot hold positions as members of the BOC or BOD. If the regulations are abused, OJK has the authority to revoke the licenses. Crypto Tax in Indonesia 2025 Beginning from January 2025, Indonesia has implemented a set of crypto taxes along with guidance on penalties. Delay in filing can result in a fixed penalty (IDR 100,000 to IDR 1,000,000) and interest charges of 2% per month, up to 24 months. Transaction Type VAT Rate Final Income Tax (PPh) Registered exchange 0.12% 0.1% Unregistered exchange Higher (prev. 0.22%) 0.2% Mining (VAT) 1.1% 0.1% (income) Crypto Adoption in Indonesia Crypto adoption rate: Crypto investors reached 14.6 million in the country , ranking third in global adoption in Q1 2025. This is an increase of up to 3.28% from the previous year‚Äôs adoption rate. The user penetration rate is predicted to be 16.56% in 2025 and is projected to increase to 16.98% by 2026. Government‚Äôs crypto holdings: Not publicly disclosed, while the country has seen significant growth in crypto transactions and usage. In Q1 2025, the crypto transaction reached IDR 109.29 trillion. Conclusion With stricter crypto regulations in the nation, investors are feeling safe to trade cryptocurrency, marking a significant growth in trading volume and user base. Popular coins like USDT, BTC, DOGE, PEPE, and XRP are driving much of the transaction volume in Indonesia. If these regulations and security measures are preserved, Indonesia may position itself as a crypto leader in Southeast Asia in the near future. [article_inside_subscriber_shortcode title=‚ÄùNever Miss a Beat in the Crypto World!‚Äù description=‚ÄùStay ahead with breaking news, expert analysis, and real-time updates on the latest trends in Bitcoin, altcoins, DeFi, NFTs, and more.‚Äù category_name=‚ÄùCrypto Regulation‚Äù category_id=‚Äù6‚Ä≥] FAQs Is cryptocurrency legal in Indonesia? Yes, cryptocurrency trading is legal in Indonesia. While cryptocurrencies are prohibited from being used as a payment instrument by Bank Indonesia, they are recognized and regulated as commodities that can be traded on futures exchanges. This legal framework allows for active participation in the crypto market. Is crypto tax-free in Indonesia? No, crypto is not tax-free in Indonesia. As of January 2025, Indonesia has implemented a crypto tax regime. Transactions are subject to Value-Added Tax (VAT) (0.11% for registered exchanges, 0.22% for unregistered) and a final income tax (0.1% for registered, 0.2% for unregistered). Crypto mining is also subject to a 0.1% income tax. Is Indonesia considered a crypto-friendly country? Yes, Indonesia is generally considered a crypto-friendly country, especially after its 2025 regulatory shifts. It ranks high globally in crypto adoption (3rd in Q1 2025) and has a tech-savvy population. The government‚Äôs moves to enhance consumer protection, increase transparency, and introduce a regulatory sandbox signal its commitment to fostering a secure and innovative crypto environment.

title: Connecticut passes law blocking the state from creating a Bitcoin reserve
body: Connecticut has officially passed a law that restricts the state government from accepting, holding, or investing in virtual currency, effectively banning the creation of a cryptocurrency reserve. On June 30, Governor Ned Lamont signed House Bill 7082 into law, following unanimous approval by both chambers of the state legislature. The legislation, now enacted as Public Act 25-66, is scheduled to take effect on October 1, 2025. The bill, introduced in February by Representative Jason Doucette, advanced swiftly through the legislative process. It passed the House and Senate without a single opposing vote, which confirms a strong bipartisan consensus on limiting state involvement with digital assets such as Bitcoin. The new law prohibits Connecticut and its political subdivisions from accepting virtual currencies for payments or from purchasing, holding, or establishing any form of digital asset reserve. The statute adopts a broad definition of ‚Äúvirtual currency‚Äù under section 36a-596 of the state‚Äôs general statutes, encompassing most cryptocurrencies in circulation today. Further, it implements extensive regulatory updates to the state‚Äôs money transmission framework and mandates that crypto businesses operating under the state‚Äôs jurisdiction maintain a 1:1 reserve backing for all customer-held digital assets. The law also introduces mandatory risk disclosures, fraud protection measures, and strict transaction limits for virtual currency kiosks commonly known as crypto ATMs. You might also like: Arizona governor vetoes bill to create Bitcoin Reserve from seized assets The legislation effectively removes Connecticut from ongoing state-level efforts to integrate Bitcoin into public treasury strategies. While some states have moved to adopt strategic reserves as part of broader digital asset initiatives, Connecticut‚Äôs blanket prohibition makes it one of the most restrictive jurisdictions in the country regarding cryptocurrency adoption by state institutions. By contrast, at least 17 U.S. states are currently reviewing legislation focused on creating state-managed Bitcoin or digital asset reserves, according to data from crypto legislation tracker Bitcoin Laws. Among them, New Hampshire and Arizona have fully enacted such frameworks, while Texas has cleared similar legislation through both chambers. However, not all efforts have succeeded. On July 1, Arizona Governor Katie Hobbs vetoed House Bill 2324, which sought to establish a Bitcoin reserve fund using cryptocurrencies seized by the government. Hobbs argued that the proposal could discourage local law enforcement from engaging in digital asset investigations by redirecting forfeited assets away from local agencies. Read more: Few central banks see Bitcoin reserves on horizon but interest in diversification still grows

title: Bitwise NEAR Staking ETP makes Xetra debut today
body: Bitwise has launched a new exchange-traded product on the Deutsche B√∂rse Xetra. The ETP offers investors exposure to AI-based blockchain NEAR with staking benefits. According to a press release sent to crypto.news, the crypto asset manager has launched its first NEAR Staking ETP on Deutsche B√∂rse‚Äôs Xetra platform. The product is meant to attract both institutional and retail investors who are looking to diversify their portfolios by investing in products grounded in digital assets. Marked with the ticker NEAR; ISIN DE000A4A5GV2, the NEAR ( NEAR ) Staking ETP is fully backed and issued in Germany, offering exposure to crypto assets as well as staking returns with low cost of ownership. The ETP is designed to accumulate daily staking yields. The addition of its NEAR Staking ETP marks the fourth Bitwise ETP to make its debut in Europe, as part of the platform‚Äôs European Total Return product suite including the already established Bitwise Ethereum ( ETH ) Staking ETP. However, the platform‚Äôs Ethereum Staking ETP has experienced a delay in its long-anticipated U.S. launch after the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission announced it would extend its review of Bitwise‚Äôs proposal on July 1. You might also like: Bitwise‚Äôs ETH staking ETF hits regulatory speed bump For investors, the NEAR Staking ETP can offer them exposure to staking rewards without having to manage the technical details of staking or token custody . This means that they can bypass having to hold NEAR directly or using third party wallets or validators. In addition, the ETP offers benefits for investors which include daily liquidity, as it is traded on regulated stock exchanges and does not prescribe to any lock-up periods or manual delegation. Additionally, the underlying NEAR tokens are held in cold storage by an institutional custodian. Head of Europe at Bitwise, Bradley Duke, said that the platform is excited to launch the new ETP in partnership with NEAR, a blockchain that makes AI technology accessible. ‚ÄúThe Bitwise NEAR Staking ETP gives investors exposure to price movements in the NEAR token as well as compounded return from staking rewards all with Bitwise‚Äôs best-in-class ETP structure,‚Äù said Duke in his statement. NEAR Protocol is a layer1 blockchain that is designed to make AI and other technological advancements accessible and useful for on-chain users. Established in 2020, NEAR addresses common challenges in blockchain by using sharding technology that enables the network to process many transactions at once. The deployment of this technology is able to solve the problems of slow transaction processing and high costs. In addition, developers can benefit from NEAR‚Äôs customizable smart contracts support multichain financial applications using secure cryptographic tools without the need for bridges or wrapped tokens. You might also like: Virtune AB launches Virtune Coinbase 50 Index ETP on Xetra

title: AI Regulation: US Senate Delivers Landmark Victory by Stripping Controversial AI Moratorium
body: BitcoinWorld AI Regulation: US Senate Delivers Landmark Victory by Stripping Controversial AI Moratorium The intersection of artificial intelligence and policy decisions often has ripple effects across various sectors, including the fast-evolving world of cryptocurrency. A recent pivotal development from the US Senate has profound implications for AI regulation , signaling a significant shift in how this transformative technology might be governed. What Just Happened with US Senate AI and Why It Matters? In a move that has sent waves through the tech and policy communities, the US Senate recently voted to remove a highly debated provision from a budget bill. This provision, often referred to as the ‚ÄòAI moratorium,‚Äô aimed to impose a long-term ban on states‚Äô abilities to enact their own AI regulation . The overwhelming bipartisan vote of 99-1 to strip this clause is a clear indicator of a legislative pivot towards allowing more localized oversight of artificial intelligence. For the cryptocurrency community, where regulatory clarity is paramount, this development underscores the complex dance between innovation and governance, suggesting a future where AI, much like digital assets, could face a diverse regulatory landscape across different states. Unpacking the Controversial AI Moratorium The now-removed AI moratorium , initially proposed by Senator Ted Cruz (R-TX) as part of the Trump administration‚Äôs ‚ÄòBig Beautiful Bill,‚Äô sought to prevent states from creating a ‚Äòpatchwork‚Äô of regulations that proponents argued could stifle AI innovation . Prominent figures from Silicon Valley, including OpenAI‚Äôs Sam Altman, Anduril‚Äôs Palmer Luckey, and a16z‚Äôs Marc Andreessen, publicly supported this federal preemption. Their argument centered on the idea that a unified federal approach would provide more clarity and foster a conducive environment for AI development without the burden of navigating disparate state laws. However, critics from both sides of the aisle voiced strong opposition, warning that such a ban would leave consumers vulnerable and allow powerful AI companies to operate with minimal accountability. The Bipartisan Push for Balanced Tech Policy The opposition to the AI moratorium transcended traditional party lines, highlighting a shared concern over the potential for unchecked corporate power and consumer harm. Democrats and many Republicans alike raised alarms that a blanket federal ban on state AI regulation would grant immense leeway to AI developers without adequate safeguards. Critics also pointed out the contentious element of Cruz‚Äôs proposal, which linked compliance with the moratorium to federal broadband funding, effectively coercing states into adherence. This bipartisan push culminated in an amendment offered by Senator Marsha Blackburn (R-TN) and Senator Maria Cantwell (D-WA) to completely strip the provision. Senator Blackburn, who had initially sought a compromise to shorten the ban from ten years to five, ultimately withdrew her support for any form of moratorium, leading to the decisive Senate vote. What Does This Mean for AI Innovation and the Future of Regulation? The removal of the AI moratorium marks a pivotal moment for AI innovation in the United States. Instead of a centralized, potentially restrictive federal ban, the path is now open for states to develop their own regulatory frameworks. This could lead to a more nuanced approach to governance, allowing states to tailor regulations to their specific economic, social, and technological contexts. While some in the tech industry might still prefer a unified federal standard to avoid complexity, others argue that state-level experimentation could lead to more effective and adaptable regulations. This decentralized approach might even foster different models of AI development and deployment, potentially leading to diverse forms of innovation as companies adapt to varying regulatory environments. It underscores the ongoing challenge of balancing rapid technological advancement with the need for robust oversight to protect consumers and ensure ethical development. Navigating the Evolving Landscape of AI and Tech Policy The Senate‚Äôs decisive action reflects a growing understanding that tech policy needs to be agile and responsive, especially concerning rapidly evolving fields like AI. This vote emphasizes the legislative body‚Äôs commitment to ensuring that technological progress is accompanied by appropriate safeguards and accountability. For stakeholders across industries, including those in the crypto space, this development highlights the importance of engaging with policymakers at all levels to shape future regulations. As AI continues to integrate into various aspects of daily life and economic activity, the ability of states to experiment with different regulatory approaches could prove invaluable in identifying best practices and fostering responsible growth. The dialogue around AI governance is far from over; in fact, it has just entered a new, more dynamic phase. The US Senate‚Äôs overwhelming vote to remove the controversial AI moratorium from the budget bill is a landmark decision that redefines the future of AI regulation in the United States. By rejecting a blanket federal ban, Congress has paved the way for states to establish their own rules, fostering a potentially diverse and adaptive regulatory landscape for AI innovation . This crucial development underscores the complex interplay between government oversight and technological advancement, setting a precedent for how future tech policy will address emerging technologies. The shift signals a more nuanced approach, balancing the need for innovation with consumer protection and accountability. To learn more about the latest AI regulation trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI policy and institutional adoption. This post AI Regulation: US Senate Delivers Landmark Victory by Stripping Controversial AI Moratorium first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: $2.4B in Crypto Stolen This Year: FATF Demands Tougher Global Crypto Rules
body: The post $2.4B in Crypto Stolen This Year: FATF Demands Tougher Global Crypto Rules appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News On June 26, the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) released updated guidelines that call for stronger global action to address illegal finance risks in virtual assets. The Paris-based watchdog called on countries to ensure the global implementation of anti-money laundering (AML) and counter terrorist financing (CFT) in virtual assets. FATF Report for Stricter Crypto Regulation FATF stated that while some progress has been made since 2024 in regulating virtual assets, many jurisdictions still have to combat risks as crypto scams surge. As part of its sixth targeted update, the agency highlights the need for licensing and registration since many jurisdictions have reported challenges in mitigating the risks of offshore virtual asset service providers (VASPs). As 99 jurisdictions have either passed or are in the process of implementing travel rules, FATF released a report on Travel Rule Supervision to ensure transparency around cross-border payments. ‚ÄúTo assist global implementation of the Travel Rule, the FATF has also published Best Practices on Travel Rule Supervision today. This report provides examples of good practices that jurisdictions may consider when developing their supervisory frameworks,‚Äù FATF said . [post_titles_links postid=‚Äù477206‚Ä≥] What triggered it? As of 2025, only 40 out of 138 jurisdictions assessed were largely compliant with FATF crypto standards, as countries continue to find difficulty in identifying the entity behind crypto transactions. FATF states, ‚ÄúWith virtual assets inherently borderless, regulatory failures in one jurisdiction can have global consequences.‚Äù This FATF report is a response to the rising concerns about illicit risk in the financial domain related to crypto. As the crypto hacks have surged in 2025, reaching over $2.47 billion, FATF appears to be laying the groundwork for safety and transparency measures in crypto transactions. Crypto Thefts in 2025 As the crypto thefts have skyrocketed from 2024‚Äî A North Korean criminal gang stole $1.46 billion from VASP Bybit (in 2025), without much recovery. Another $51 billion was stolen in illicit on-chain activity in 2024 These thefts prompted the regulator to urge stricter regulations and action for crypto transactions and norms for VASPs. [article_inside_subscriber_shortcode title=‚ÄùNever Miss a Beat in the Crypto World!‚Äù description=‚ÄùStay ahead with breaking news, expert analysis, and real-time updates on the latest trends in Bitcoin, altcoins, DeFi, NFTs, and more.‚Äù category_name=‚ÄùNews‚Äù category_id=‚Äù6‚Ä≥] FAQs What is FATF? FATF (Financial Action Task Force) is an intergovernmental body that sets global standards to combat money laundering and terrorist financing. Why is FATF pushing for stricter crypto regulations? Rising crypto hacks and weak compliance pushed FATF to urge stronger global AML/CFT action for digital assets. How many countries will comply with FATF crypto standards in 2025? Only 40 out of 138 countries assessed are mostly compliant with FATF‚Äôs virtual asset rules in 2025.

title: Ripple vs SEC: Will XRP Case Officially End On July 3? Here‚Äôs What Is Coming
body: A recent tweet by crypto analyst and investor Xaif has drawn considerable attention within the cryptocurrency community. Xaif highlighted that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has scheduled a closed meeting for 2:00 p.m. Eastern Time on Thursday, July 3, 2025. According to the official Sunshine Act Notice issued by the SEC, this meeting will be held remotely and at the Commission‚Äôs headquarters in Washington, D.C. The notice confirms that the meeting will be closed to the public. The official matters to be considered include institution and settlement of injunctive actions, institution and settlement of administrative proceedings, resolution of litigation claims, and other matters relating to examinations and enforcement proceedings. The notice emphasizes that changes in the Commission‚Äôs priorities may require alterations in the meeting agenda, which could involve adjudicatory, examination, litigation, or regulatory matters. XRP vs SEC: Is July 3 the Date the Lawsuit Officially Ends? The SEC will hold a closed meeting on July 3 at 2:00 PM ET to discuss litigation resolutions, sparking rumors it may vote to withdraw its Ripple appeal. #XRP #Ripple pic.twitter.com/9RW03w9hc3 ‚Äî ùïèaif | (@Xaif_Crypto) June 30, 2025 Connection to the Ongoing XRP Lawsuit Xaif‚Äôs tweet focuses on the potential implications of this closed meeting for the ongoing litigation between the SEC and Ripple , the company associated with XRP. The analyst questioned whether July 3 could be the date when the lawsuit officially concludes. This speculation is based on the inclusion of ‚Äúresolution of litigation claims‚Äù in the list of topics to be discussed at the meeting. Xaif suggested that one possible outcome could be the SEC voting to withdraw its appeal in the Ripple case. This speculation is particularly relevant given the protracted nature of the SEC‚Äôs legal action against Ripple, which has extended over several years. Although the official notice does not specify which litigation matters will be addressed, the coincidence of the meeting‚Äôs agenda with critical stages in the Ripple case has heightened anticipation among XRP holders and market participants. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 Reactions From the XRP Community Several users on the social media platform X responded to Xaif‚Äôs post. One user, Michael, expressed cautious optimism, stating that in previous instances when the XRP community expected significant outcomes from Sunshine Act meetings, those expectations were often unmet. He suggested that managing expectations might be prudent, noting, ‚ÄúMaybe expect nothing and get a surprise.‚Äù Marc Fagel, a retired securities lawyer, offered a humorous yet insightful commentary on the situation. Reflecting on his own experience attending SEC closed meetings, he remarked on how surprising it is to see such meetings become the subject of widespread speculation online. Fagel‚Äôs comment highlighted the fact that while closed meetings are routine for regulatory bodies like the SEC, they are now increasingly monitored by the cryptocurrency community due to the high-profile nature of certain cases, such as the one involving Ripple. Analysis of Possible Outcomes While the meeting agenda includes general litigation matters, there is no official confirmation that the Ripple case will be specifically addressed. The Sunshine Act Notice cites legal exemptions under 5 U.S.C. 552b and related regulations that permit the meeting to remain confidential. As a result, the public will not have access to the details or outcomes of the discussions until any formal announcements are made by the SEC. title: Ethereum‚Äôs short-term outlook weakens amid rising exchange inflows and falling open interest
body: Ethereum‚Äôs recent rally may be losing momentum as exchange inflows rise and derivatives data point to softening market support. Nearly 100,000 ETH, or about $250 million, were deposited into Binance in two sizable waves, as per a July 1 analysis by CryptoQuant contributor Amr Taha. These deposits, which usually indicate larger exchange reserves, may result in selling pressure if market sentiment shifts. Taha also observed that the gap between Ethereum spot price and the open interest on Binance was growing. Since June 26, ETH has shown steady buying in the spot market, reaching three consecutive local highs above $2,500. However, Binance Open Interest has lagged, hitting a series of lower highs below $5.6 billion. This suggests that fewer traders are opening new positions, which could be a sign of caution or uncertainty about the strength of the move. You might also like: Ethereum sees growing institutional interest as Bit Digital raises $162.9M to buy more ETH The continuous reduction in U.S. Federal Reserve net liquidity is another factor that might add to the uncertainty. Liquidity has decreased from about $6.2 trillion to $5.84 trillion in recent weeks. Lower liquidity tends to limit risk-taking by reducing access to capital in both traditional and crypto markets. Unless Ethereum sees high demand from buyers ready to absorb this environment, its upside might be limited in the short-term. Ethereum is trading at $2,451 at press time, down 0.5% over the last day. The price is approaching $2,455, which has acted as resistance over the previous week and marks the 20-day simple moving average. Technical indicators, such as the tightening Bollinger Bands and the relative strength index at 48.9, indicate that the market is in a consolidation phase with little volatility and no clear directional bias. ETH price analysis. Credit: crypto.news Although oscillators like the Stochastic RSI are approaching overbought territory, which limits the potential for short-term upside, momentum and MACD indicators display mild bullish signals. Longer-term averages are still above the current price, suggesting broader weakness. Short-term moving averages, such as the 10-day and 50-day exponential averages, are offering little support. The next upward target might be the upper Bollinger Band around $2,622 if buying pressure returns and Ethereum breaks above $2,500 with increased volume and rising open interest. If current support gives way and exchange inflows keep outpacing demand, the price might retest the lower band around $2,287, increasing the risk of a deeper pullback. title: Trump Gaza Ceasefire: A Pivotal Breakthrough for Lasting Peace?
body: BitcoinWorld Trump Gaza Ceasefire: A Pivotal Breakthrough for Lasting Peace? In a significant development that has sent ripples across global geopolitical landscapes, former U.S. President Donald Trump recently announced on Truth Social that Israel has agreed to the terms for a proposed 60-day ceasefire in Gaza. This announcement, made after what Trump described as a productive meeting between his representatives and Israeli officials, marks a potentially pivotal moment in the protracted Middle East conflict. For those tracking global events, including their impact on financial markets and even the evolving cryptocurrency space, understanding the nuances of this Trump Gaza ceasefire initiative is crucial. Geopolitical stability often underpins market confidence, and a breakthrough here could signal broader shifts. Understanding the Trump Gaza Ceasefire Proposal: What‚Äôs on the Table? The core of this latest initiative revolves around a 60-day cessation of hostilities in the Gaza Strip. While specific details of the proposed terms have not been fully disclosed to the public, such agreements typically involve a multi-faceted approach aimed at de-escalation and humanitarian aid. Historically, ceasefire proposals encompass prisoner exchanges, the entry of humanitarian assistance, and guarantees for the safety of civilians. Trump‚Äôs involvement, even out of office, highlights the enduring influence of U.S. diplomacy in the region. Duration and Scope: A 60-day period offers a substantial window for de-escalation and potentially for more comprehensive negotiations, unlike shorter, temporary truces. Key Mediators: Qatar and Egypt are slated to present the final proposal to Hamas, underscoring their critical roles as long-standing intermediaries in the region. Their diplomatic channels are vital for communication with Hamas. Humanitarian Imperative: Any effective ceasefire must address the dire humanitarian situation in Gaza, including the delivery of aid, medical supplies, and ensuring civilian safety. Israel‚Äôs Stance: Why This Israel Peace Deal Matters Now? Israel‚Äôs reported agreement to the terms signals a potential shift in its strategic approach, or at least a willingness to explore diplomatic avenues amidst ongoing military operations. For Israel, a ceasefire could offer several strategic advantages, including the potential return of hostages and a temporary reduction in security threats from Gaza. However, reaching an Israel peace deal with Hamas has always been fraught with complex security concerns and internal political pressures. The decision to agree to terms for this 60-day proposal reflects a careful balancing act between military objectives and the imperative to secure the release of captives and alleviate international pressure. The Israeli government faces immense pressure from its public regarding the hostages held in Gaza. A ceasefire agreement, even a temporary one, could pave the way for their release, which is a primary objective. Furthermore, international pressure for de-escalation and humanitarian access has been mounting, making diplomatic solutions increasingly attractive. This particular proposal, facilitated by Trump‚Äôs team, adds a unique dimension given his past diplomatic efforts in the region, including the Abraham Accords. Hamas‚Äôs Crucial Decision: Will a Gaza Conflict Resolution Emerge? The ball is now firmly in Hamas‚Äôs court. Trump explicitly warned that conditions for the group would not improve if the deal is rejected, emphasizing the urgency and the potential finality of this offer. Hamas‚Äôs decision will determine whether this initiative leads to a much-needed Gaza conflict resolution or if the conflict escalates further. The group‚Äôs demands typically include a complete cessation of hostilities, the lifting of the blockade on Gaza, and the release of Palestinian prisoners. Reconciling these demands with Israel‚Äôs security imperatives remains the central challenge. Hamas operates under its own set of internal and external pressures. Its leadership must weigh the benefits of a humanitarian pause and potential prisoner exchanges against its stated objectives and the expectations of its supporters. The decision will likely be influenced by a complex calculus involving its strategic goals, the well-being of the Gazan population, and its standing among other Palestinian factions. The coming days will be critical as the world watches for their response. Navigating the Broader Middle East Stability: Regional Implications Beyond the immediate parties, the potential 60-day ceasefire carries significant implications for broader Middle East stability. Regional actors like Egypt, Jordan, and Saudi Arabia have vested interests in de-escalation and a pathway to peace. A successful ceasefire could foster greater regional cooperation and reduce the risk of wider conflict. Conversely, a rejection or failure of the deal could exacerbate tensions, potentially drawing in other regional players and further destabilizing an already volatile area. The roles of Qatar and Egypt as primary mediators are vital. Qatar, known for its channels with Hamas, and Egypt, sharing a border with Gaza and historically a key mediator, are uniquely positioned to facilitate these delicate negotiations. Their success in presenting and advocating for the proposal will be crucial in achieving a positive outcome. The stability of the region is interconnected, and progress in Gaza can have a ripple effect across the Levant and beyond. Anticipating the Hamas Response: What‚Äôs Next for the Region? All eyes are now on Hamas as they deliberate on the proposed Hamas ceasefire terms. Their decision will dictate the immediate future of the Gaza Strip and potentially the broader Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Several scenarios could unfold: Acceptance: If Hamas accepts, a 60-day ceasefire would commence, allowing for humanitarian aid, prisoner exchanges, and a window for further negotiations on a more permanent resolution. This would be a significant step towards de-escalation. Conditional Acceptance: Hamas might accept with conditions, leading to further rounds of negotiations and potential delays. This is a common tactic in complex peace processes. Rejection: A full rejection would likely lead to continued military operations and a worsening humanitarian crisis, as warned by Trump. This would signal a continuation of the current devastating conflict. The coming days will be critical. The world awaits Hamas‚Äôs response, which will undoubtedly shape the immediate trajectory of the conflict and the lives of millions. The stakes could not be higher. The Road Ahead: Challenges and Hopes While the prospect of a 60-day ceasefire offers a glimmer of hope, the path to a lasting peace in the region is fraught with challenges. Deep-seated mistrust, conflicting narratives, and complex political realities make comprehensive resolution incredibly difficult. However, every step towards de-escalation, no matter how small, is a move in the right direction. Key Challenges: Trust Deficit: Years of conflict have built immense mistrust between all parties, making genuine negotiation difficult. Internal Divisions: Both Israeli and Palestinian political landscapes are complex, with internal factions that may oppose any compromise. Enforcement Mechanisms: Ensuring compliance with ceasefire terms requires robust monitoring and enforcement, which can be challenging in a conflict zone. Root Causes: A 60-day ceasefire is a temporary measure; it does not address the underlying political and territorial disputes that fuel the conflict. Potential Benefits of a Successful Ceasefire: Humanitarian Relief: Immediate and critical aid can reach those in desperate need in Gaza. Hostage Release: A primary goal for Israel and a significant humanitarian outcome. De-escalation: Reduces immediate violence and the risk of regional spillover. Diplomatic Window: Provides an opportunity for further, more comprehensive peace talks. In conclusion, Donald Trump‚Äôs announcement of Israel‚Äôs agreement to a 60-day Gaza ceasefire proposal marks a crucial moment in the ongoing Middle East conflict. The ball is now in Hamas‚Äôs court, and their decision will significantly impact the humanitarian situation and the prospects for regional stability. While the path to lasting peace remains challenging, this initiative offers a vital opportunity for de-escalation and a potential step towards a more hopeful future for all involved. To learn more about the latest geopolitical trends and their impact on global markets, explore our article on key developments shaping Middle East stability and international relations. title: Alibaba is opening new data centers in Southeast Asia
body: Alibaba Group is ramping up its AI ambitions with a major infrastructure boost across Southeast Asia. Its cloud division, Alibaba Cloud, has launched a third data center in Malaysia and plans to open a second in the Philippines this October. The new Malaysian facility went live earlier this week. It will offer increased computing power and storage for regional businesses and governments undergoing digital transformation. Intended for launch later in October, the Philippine center is anticipated to beef up local competencies in AI workloads, data analytics, and cloud-native services. Alibaba says these centers will be conveniently located to support Asia‚Äôs rising demand for artificial intelligence-based cloud offerings. By making its AI tools more readily available, the company aims to appeal to startups, enterprises, and public institutions searching for scalable digital infrastructure. A company spokesman said Alibaba Cloud‚Äôs investment in the region was due to its optimism about Southeast Asia‚Äôs growth prospects and digital future, and that it hoped to foster local innovation with secure, intelligent, and sustainable cloud solutions . Singapore hosts the world‚Äôs AI competency center Alibaba Cloud has also announced the opening of a Global AI Competency in Singapore. The facility is intended to develop the next generation of AI developers and speed up the application of cutting-edge AI technologies in sectors ranging from finance to automotive. The center will strive to help more than 5,000 businesses and provide skills and access to Alibaba‚Äôs Qwen AI models and tools for more than 100,000 developers. There will also be training on topics including machine learning, computer vision, natural language processing, and the responsible use of AI. Alibaba said the hub will be a place for collaborative workshops, labs, and technical call centers to support businesses integrating AI into their operations. Manufacturing, retail, logistics, health, and finance are some of the prime targets. ‚ÄúGlobalization is Alibaba Cloud‚Äôs long-term strategy,‚Äù Eddie Wu, chief executive officer of Alibaba Cloud, said in a video message at a company event in Singapore on Wednesday. The centre also ties in with the Smart Nation drive in Singapore as the city-state seeks to become a regional hub for AI innovation and digital transformation. Alibaba commits $53 billion to global AI network Alibaba‚Äôs recent steps are all part of a much larger goal: to lead the way in the next generation of AI-based business infrastructure. The company will funnel over $53 billion into building artificial intelligence and cloud infrastructure worldwide in the next three years. It is also building infrastructure in other countries, including Thailand, Mexico, and South Korea, a sign that it is looking to expand to other global markets and reduce customer latency. After making a splash in Chinese e-commerce, the company is expanding to AI tools and services built on its own Qwen AI models, including everything from an AI platform to large language models pre-trained for enterprise usage. In February 2025, CEO Eddie Wu declared that Alibaba‚Äôs new mission is to pursue Artificial General Intelligence (AGI)‚ÄîAI capable of reasoning and problem-solving like a human. The bold announcement sets the company on a direct collision course with US tech giants like Google, Microsoft, and Amazon, as well as an increasingly competitive field of AI labs across Asia.
